CAL(1) User Commands CAL(1)

NAME

cal - print calendar

SYNOPSIS

cal [[month] year]

DESCRIPTION

Cal prints a calendar for the specified year. If a month is also specified, a calendar just for that month is printed. If no year is given, the calendar for the current month is printed. Year can be between 1 and 9999. The month is a number between 1 and 12. The calendar produced is that for England and her colonies.
Try September 1752.

ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES

LANG, LC_ALL, LC_CTYPE, LC_TIME
Determines the month and weekday strings.

SEE ALSO

calendar(1), date(1), locale(7)

NOTES

The year is always considered to start in January even though this is historically naive.
 
Beware that `cal 78' refers to the early Christian era, not the 20th century.
1/11/03 Heirloom Toolchest
